text:
Loreley "Lee" June Phillip Bell (June 10, 1928 – February 25, 2020) was an American talk show host and soap opera creator. During her career on Chicago television, she hosted over 10,000 programs. Her best known works were "The Bold and the Beautiful" and "The Young and the Restless". Bell was born in Chicago.
Bell died on February 25, 2020 at her home in Beverly Hills, California at the age of 91.
